did.unittitle: New York, Newfoundland, and London Telegraph Company Records
did.abstract: Founded in 1852 in New York City, the New York, Newfoundland, and London Telegraph Company was a company that preluded the first trans-Atlantic cable. This collection contains the minutes of meetings of this company's "corporators," including Peter Cooper, Cyrus W. Field, Frederick N. Gisborne, Moses Taylor, and others.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Founded in 1852 in New York City, the New York, Newfoundland, and London Telegraph Company was a company that preluded the first trans-Atlantic cable. Charles Bright, Cyrus W. Field, and John Watkins Bret became representatives of the company. The founders wanted the telegraph line to run from Nova Scotia through Newfoundland. In 1853, the company was taken over by the Anglo-American Telegraph Company (AAT).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the minutes of meetings of this New York City company's "corporators," including Peter Cooper, Cyrus W. Field, Frederick N. Gisborne, Moses Taylor, and others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.
